verbose_text: Accordingly, the effects of zinc on cellular homeostasis appear to be numerous and include the stimulation of glucose uptake and lipogenesis in adipocytes [XREF_BIBR], tyrosine phosphorylation of the insulin / IGF-1 receptor and insulin receptor substrate-1 [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR], activation of epidermal growth factor receptor [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR], inhibition of protein tyrosine phosphatase (PTP) [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR], and subsequent activation of mitogen activated protein kinases (MAPKs) including extracellular-signal-regulated kinases 1 and 2 (ERK1/2), c-Jun N-terminal kinase (JNK) and p38 [XREF_BIBR], and an increase in glycogen synthesis through the inhibition of glycogen synthase kinase-3 [XREF_BIBR].
